result.execSummary:
The defendant Philip N Holland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs Pursuant to Statute. Sentence credit of 1031 days were granted.

Costs to be paid as a condition of sentence. 
  Court ordered financial obligations and restitution payable out of 25% of inmate's funds while incarcerated.

Restitution for H.M. ($587.20); M.U. ($794.00); C.M. ($4,750.00) and P.M. ($395.20) for a total of $6,526.40 to be paid as a condition of sentence. Restitution to be paid before costs and fees. 
  Court ordered financial obligations and restitution payable out of 25% of inmate's funds while incarcerated.

No Contact with any of the victim's family members. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of sentence.

Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. To be served in the State Prison System. Sentence credit of 1031 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 1
Costs to be paid as a condition of sentence.

Straight Time. To be served in the State Prison System. Sentence credit of 1031 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Counts 1 & 2

Court ordered financial obligations and restitution payable out of 25% of inmate's funds while incarcerated.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Summary.
To be sealed - Per Judge Dreyfus - Not to be released without permission of the court.

Michele W. Hulgaard and ADA Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
Count 1:
LIFE SENTENCE.
Extended Supervision: - Not Eligible.
Concurrent to:  Counts 2 & 3.
1,031 Days of Credit.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program - Pursuant to Statute.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program - Pursuant to Statute.

CONDITIONS OF THE SENTENCE:  
No contact with:  any of the victim's family members.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

Restitution:  $6,526.40 - Breakdown:  $587.20 to H.M.;  $794 to M.U.;  $4,750 to C.M.;  and $395.20 to P.M. - to be paid before any fines/costs/surcharges.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  




Count 2:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
To be served in the State Prison System.
Concurrent to:  Counts 1 & 3.
1,031 Days of Credit.

Costs:  $243
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.




Count 3:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail.
To be served in the State Prison System.
Concurrent to:  Counts 1 & 2.
1,031 Days of Credit.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.


Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
Per Judge Dreyfus - To be held without bail pending sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on July 13, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Juror Note - Requesting autopsy photos and autopsy protocol.
Given to the jurors.

Juror Note - Requesting Crime Scene Photos and Diagram.
Provided to the jurors.
Jurors Selected For Case - Alternate List.

From Jury Trial held on 05/14/18 - 05/18/18.

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.

Jury Trial - Day Five.
Continued from 05/17/18.
Michele W. Hulgaard and Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   

Court back on the record @ 9:13 pm.
Court addressed with the defendant his right to testify or not testify - Court conducts colloquy.
Defendant requests to testify.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 9:17 am.

Witness Called:  Detective Michelle Trussoni (City of Waukesha Police Department).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Objection raised - requests to be heard outside the presences of the jurors.
Jurors excused @ 9:39 am.
Arguments presented by both parties.
Court is satisfied the door has not been opened and is not relevant.
Court denies defense request.
Reasons placed on the record.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 10:30 am.

Exhibits offered and received:  2 & 113.

State rests.

Jurors excused @ 10:39 am.

Defense moves to dismiss count 3 - Arguments presented.
State objects - Arguments presented.
Defense presented rebuttal.
Court Denies - Defense request to dismiss count 3.
Reasons placed on the record.

Court in brief adjournment @ 10:43 am.
Court back on the record @ 10:54 am.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 11:01 am.

Witness Called:  Philip Holland (Defendant).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Defense rests.

Jurors excused for lunch @ 12:57 pm.
Court in adjournment for lunch @ 1:00 pm.

Court back on the record @ 1:58 pm.
Court addressed with the parties the jury instructions and verdicts.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 2:30 pm.
Court read to the jurors part of the jury instructions.

State presented closing arguments.
Defense presented closing arguments.
State presented rebuttal.

Court read the final jury instructions and verdicts to the jurors.
Clerk swears in the bailiff.
Court read the two alternate names - Those two jurors were thanked for their service and excused.
Jurors excused for deliberations @ 4:00 pm.
Court in adjournment @ 4:04 pm.

Court back on the record @ 4:38 pm.
Court called all the parties back to discuss a juror question - requesting the autopsy protocol.
Parties have no objections to jurors getting the autopsy protocol.
Court back in adjournment @ 4:41 pm.

Jurors notified the bailiff they had a verdict @ 5 pm.
Court back on the record @ 5:12 pm.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 5:13 pm.
Court read the verdicts:   As to Count 1:  GUILTY - 1ST DEGREE INTENTIONAL HOMICIDE; Count 2:  GUILTY ;  Count 3:  GUILTY.
State moves for judgment on the verdicts.
Defense requests the jurors be polled.
Clerk polls the jurors.
Parties are satisfied with the polling of the jurors.
Defense moves for judgment of acquittal not withstanding the verdicts.
Court Denies - Defense request.
Court receives the verdict and enters judgment.

State requests the court allow the victim's family members appear by phone for the sentencing.
State also requests bail be revoked.

Court revokes bail pending sentencing - Defendant to held without bail.
Court takes under advisement the state's request to allow the victim's family to appear by phone for sentencing.
Jurors excused @ 5:20 pm.
Court in adjournment @ 5:22 pm




  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Jury Trial - Day Four
Continued from:  05/16/18.
Michele W. Hulgaard and Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.

Court on the record @ 9:02 am.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 9:14 am.

State played part of the DVD interview - 09:15 am. - 10:01 am.
State requests to be heard outside the presence of the jurors.
Jurors excused 10:01 am.
State presented statements regarding an up coming portion of the DVD interview that will be played.
Defense objects and presented arguments.
Responses and replies  presented.
Court made it's decision.
Reasons placed on the record.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @  10:27 am.
State continues to play the DVD interview - 10:28 am. - 12:21 pm.
Jurors excused for lunch @ 12:22 pm.
Court in adjournment for lunch @ 12:23 pm.

Court back on the record @ 1:45 pm.
Defense raised objection to the photos of the medical examiner being used by the State.
State objects and presented arguments.
Responses and replies presented.
Court denies the defense motion (State will be allowed to use the Medical Examiner Photos).
Reasons placed on the record.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 1:58 pm.

State continues to play DVD interview - 1:59 pm. - 3:00 pm.
Jurors excused for a brief adjournment @ 3 pm.
Court in brief adjournment @ 3:01 pm.

Court on the record @ 3:25 pm.
Jurors back in the courtroom @ 3:26 pm.

Witness Called:  Dr. Amy Sheil (Associate Medical Examiner for Waukesha County).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Jurors excused for brief recess @ 4:14 pm.
Court in brief recess @ 4:14 pm.
Court back on the record @ 4:24 pm.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 4:25 pm.

Witnesses Called:  Vicki Holland (Ex-Wife of the Defendant), Shannon Holland (Defendant's Daughter), Deputy Kevin Harvancik (Dodge County Sheriff's Department), Mary Madden (Director of NAMI for Waukesha County) and Andrea Grittner (Director of Developement and Marketing for NAMI of Waukesha County).
Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Exhibits Marked:  105 - 113.
Exhibits Offered and Received:  72, 73, 105 - 112.

Jurors excused for the evening @ 5:04 pm.
Both parties received a copy of proposed jury instructions. 
Court addressed with the parties what exhibits would be allowed back with the jurors if requested.
Both State and Defense request the court read the jury instructions to the jurors prior to closing arguments.
Court in adjournment for the evening @ 5:12 pm.

From Jury Trial Held on 05/14/18 - 05/18/18.
Exhibits: 1 - 27, 29, 31 - 67, 74 - 80, 82 - 113. 

Exhibits:  68 - 73 - Interview DVD's - Not Scannable - Will need to be held for the retention period - Stored in the exhibit room.
Exhibit:  81 - Hatchet - Returned to the City of Waukesha Police Deparment for maintenance/storage and destruction pursuant to statute.

Exhibits:  28 & 30 - Denied by the Court.

Jury Trial - Day Three
Continued from 05/16/18.
Michele W. Hulgaard and Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.

Court back on the record @ 9 am.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 9:05 am.

State continues with DVD Interview - 9:07 am. - 10:42 am.

Jurors excused for a brief adjournment @ 10:42 am.
Court in brief adjournment @ 10:43 am.
Court back on the record @ 11:00 am.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @  11:01 am.

State continues with DVD Interview - 11:03 am. - Noon.
Juror excused for lunch @ 12:05 pm.
Court adjourned for lunch @ 12:08 pm.

Court back on the record @ 1:25 pm.
Jurors back on in the courtroom @ 1:34 pm.

Witnesses Called:  Specialist Andre Schmidt (City of Waukesha Police Department), Specialist Erin Christensen (City of Waukesha Police Department),
Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

State plays audio recording - 2:19 pm. - 2:27 pm.

Witness Called:  Michelle Trussoni (City of Waukesha Police Department).
Witness Sworn and Testified.

Witnesses Called:  Deputy Daniel Sponder (Waukesha County Sheriff's Department), Detective Jack Kopatich (Waukesha County Sheriff's Department), Specialist Nichelle Nelson (City of Waukesha Police Department).
Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Juror excused for the evening @ 4:50 pm.
Court addressed with the parties defense objects to parts of the DVD that will be played tomorrow.
Responses and replies presented.
Court made it's decision.
Reasons placed on the record.

Exhibits Marked:  74 - 104.
Exhibits Offered and Received:  68 - 71, 74 - 80 & 82 - 104.
Exhibit:  81 Returned to the City of Waukesha Police Department for maintenance/storage and destruction pursuant to statute.

Court in adjournment @ 5:15 pm.

Jury Trial - Day Two.
Continued from 05/14/18.
Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.

Court back on the record @ 9:09 am.
Defense is requesting the court limit the amount crime scene photos the can use - arguments presented.
State objects and presented arguments.
Defense presented a response.
Court will withhold decision at this time.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 9:18 am.

Witnesses Called:  Iris Bulson (Friend of the victim), Artis Bradley (Victim's Supervisor) and Specialist David Platta (City of Waukesha Police Department).
All Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Jurors excused for a brief adjournment @ 10:36 am.
Court in a brief recess @ 10:38 am.

Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 10:59 am.

Witnesses Called:  Specialist David Platta (City of Waukesha Police Department) - testimony continued, Detective David Feyen (City of Waukesha Police Department) and 
Detective Michelle Trussoni (City of Waukesha Police Department).
All Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Jurors excused for lunch @ 11:59 am.
Court in adjournment for lunch @ 12:00 pm.

Court back on the record @ 1:12 pm.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 1:14 pm.

Witnesses Called:  Wendy Beaudry (Neighbor of Defendant), Mark Quale (Friend of the Defendant) and Lauren Langsford (Ex-Girlfriend of the Defendant).
All Witnesses Sworn and Testified.
Defense would like to raise an issue outside the presence of the jurors.

Jurors excused @ 1:54 pm.
Defense is moving for a mistrial (manifest injustice) - arguments presented.
State objects and presented arguments.
Defense presented response.
Court Denies - Defense request for a Mistrial - No Basis.
Reasons placed on the record.
Defense requests that statement be struck.
Court Denies - Defense request to strick the statement.
Reasons placed on the record.

Court in a brief recess @ 2:13 pm.
Court back on the record @ 2:57 pm.
Statements presented by both the State and Defense regarding the playing of the DVD - Interviews.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 2:58 pm.

State played part of video interview between City of Waukesha Police Department and the defendant - DVD from 3 pm. - 5:15 pm.
Juror excused for the evening @ 5:17 pm.
Court in adjournment for the evening @ 5:19 pm.

Exhibits Marked:  7- 73.
Exhibits Offered and Received:  7 - 27, 29, 31 - 67.
Exhibits denied by the court:  28, 30
Jury trial - 12 person on May 18, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Jury Trial - Day One.
Michele W. Hulgaard and Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   
Jury Selection - 8 Strikes each side - 2 alternates - 30 potential jurors in the box.

Both State and Defense have received a copy of the Alphabetical Voir Dire List.
State requests to strike for cause Juror #448 - Reasons placed on the record.
Defense has no objections to striking juror #448.
Court Grants - Juror #448 is struck for cause.

Court addressed with the parties courtroom proceedure.

Bailiff sent to the JAR to get the 64 potential jurors @ 9:44 pm.
64 Potential jurors brought up @ 10:06 am.
Court addressed all potential jurors.
All potential jurors sworn in.

Court conducts voir dire.
State conducts voir dire.
Juror #513 struck for cause.
State continues with voir dire.
Juror #527 struck for cause.
State continues with voir dire.

Jurors excused for a brief break @ 11:18 am.
State and Defense conducts individual voir dire with juror #455.
Court strikes juror #455 for cause.
Court in brief adjournment @ 11:33 am.

Court back on the record @ 11:43 am.
State continues with voir dire.
Defense conducts voir dire.

Parties conduct their strikes.
Clerk read the 14 selected names.
14 Selected Jurors Sworn in.
Unselected Jurors returned to the Jar @ 12:38 pm.

Jurors excused for lunch @ 12:42 pm.
Court in adjournment for lunch @ 12:43 pm.

Court back on the record @ 1:57 pm.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 2:03 pm.

State presented opening statements.
Defense presented opening statements.

Witnesses Called:  Dr. Richard Minkley (Victim's Uncle) and Officer Patrick Sanford (City of Waukesha Police Department).
Witnesses sworn and testified.

Jurors excused for the evening @ 2:46 pm.

Exhibits Marked:  1 - 6.
Exhibits Offered and Received:  1 & 3 - 6
Exhibit #2 Never offered or received.

Court in adjournment for the evening @ 2:51 pm.

Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   
Court to Address - Jury Questionnaires  (formal and content) and Deadlines.

State presented arguments to the court.

Court orders the Name and Case Number should not be disclosed anywhere on the questionnaires.

Potential Deadlines:

Jury trial - 12 person on May 14, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Motion hearing on February 15, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
for Adjournment filed by State.

Per review by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., of the documents filed on 05/15/17 regarding the victim's mental health, the court finds the only proceeding was from 1998 and was dismissed prior to the probable cause hearing.  Therefore, the court finds there was no mental health determination, and the document is not relavant and not releasable to the State or Defense.
Hearing on March 9, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   
Court to Address:  Oral Ruling on Schiffra Green Motion and Possible Jury Questionnaires.

Court Denies - Defense Other Acts Evidence Motion regarding Schiffra Green.
Defense has not made a sufficient showing.
Reasons placed on the record.

Court has received some mental health record under seal regarding the victim - received from the Juvenile Center on 05/15/17.
Court will review those records and make a determination if those records can be released to the State and Defense.

Defense is requesting a jury questionnaire.
Court directs the proposed jury questionnaires be e-mailed under seal by 03/07/18.  Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   
Court will make an Oral Ruling on:
Whether or not all the documents filed under seal on 05/11/17 & 05/12/17 can be released to the defense for further investigation under their Shiffra Green Motion and the State's Other Acts Evidence/McMorris Motion.

A majority of the documents filed under seal by the State are police reporters that refer to victim as the complaintiff.
Court will allow for the Defense to view those documents including the inventory photos.
Reasons placed on the record.

Court will also allow for the State's Other Acts Evidence Motion.
Reasons placed on the record.

Exhibit #1 - From Motion Hearing Held on 12/05/17 - Scanned

Michele W. Hulgaard and ADA Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Philip N Holland in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.   
Court to Address:  Miranda Goodchild Motion/Scheduling of Oral Ruling on other Acts Motion and Decision on in Camera Review of Documents.

1)  Miranda Goodchild Motion:
State placed the Stipulation of the parties on the record.
Parties stipulate to the date/times of the interviews and that miranda was given on the first day of interview and miranda was not given on day two or three.

Witnesses Called:  Detective Michelle Trussoni (City of Waukesha Police Department) and Detective Ellene Micklitz (City of Waukesha Police Department).
Witnesses Sworn and Testified.

Exhibit Marked:  1.
Exhibit 1 Offered and Received.

Testimony Closed.
State presented closing arguments.
Defense presented closing arguments.
State presented rebuttal.

Court finds and orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the defendant was in custody during all three days of interviews.
Therefore, Court is satisfied this was a custodial interrogation and subject to miranda warning.
Court finds the Miranda Warnings were properly given on the first day of interviews.
Only question is whether the Miranda Warnings carried over to all three day.
Based on the record provided, there is nothing that shows that the defendant was under the influence of anything during the interviews.
Defendant was brought back to the same room each day with the same detectives and the same line of questioning.
Based on the record, Court finds there is nothing that shows the defendant didn't understand his Miranda rights.
Court also finds there is no requirement that the defendant be Mirandized each day of the interrogation.
Court finds the Miranda Warnings were properly given and carried over to all three days of interrogation.
All evidence/information provided during the interrogation is admissible by the State.


2)  Other Acts Evidence Motion:
Witness Called:  Detective Michelle Trussoni (City of Waukesha Police Department).
Witness acknowledges she is still under oath - Testimony provided.

Defense requests the court withhold entry of of a oral ruling pending further investigation (regarding Shiffra Green).
Def. to file any responses by:  01/05/18.
State to file any response by:  01/19/18.

As it pertains to McMorris:
State presented arguments.
Defense presented arguments.
Responses and replies presented.
Court puts matter over for Oral Ruling.


Court will make an Oral Ruling on Monday 12/11/17 @ 9:00 am. as to whether or not the all the documents filed under seal on 05/11/17 & 05/12/17 can be released to the defense for further investigation under Shiffra Green Motion and the State's Other Acts Evidence/McMorris Motion.

Court acknowledged the Speedy Trial Demand filed by the defense.  Matter is currently scheduled for trial within the Speedy Trial Demand statutory time frame.
State is forwarding the Discovery Material from the medical examiners office as requested by the Defense Motion to Compel Discovery, resolving that motion.

Atty. Hulgaard and Atty. Suha presented arguments to the court.
Atty. Kegel presented arguments to the court (Defense position is there is no conflict - Conflict raised by the State is only speculative).
Responses and replies presented.

Court directs that Atty. Kegel file the signed written waivers from both the Defendant, and Mr. Trott under seal for the court's review by:  04/19/17.


Court finds there is no conflict at this time.
Therefore, Court Denies the State's Motion to Disqualify the Defense Attorneys at this time.
However, court may readdress upon review of the Waivers that will be provided under seal.
